metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3152 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Oracle MySQL before 5.7.3, Oracle MySQL Connector/C (aka libmysqlclient)before 6.1.3, and MariaDB before 5.5.44 use the --ssl option to mean thatSSL is optional, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof serversvia a cleartext-downgrade attack, aka a "BACKRONYM" attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.44-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
